verbs.description: ail (third-person singular simple present ails, present participle ailing, simple past and past participle ailed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to suffer; to trouble, afflict. (Now chiefly in interrogative or indefinite constructions.)
examples: Have some chicken soup. It's good for what ails you.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To be ill; to suffer; to be troubled.
examples: When he ails ever so little  [â€¦]  he is so peevish.

adjectives.description: ail (comparative ailer or more ail, superlative ailest or most ail)
